edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj.Engine

  • public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the game engine and is where all of the game logic and operations take place in.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Grid board
      A reference to the Grid that gameplay takes place on, instantiated by setupGrid() or Engine#loadGame().
      private java.util.ArrayList<WorldItem> items
      A list that will hold all of the items, which once again will dynamically change over the course of the game and initialization.
      private int NINJA_TRACKING_DISTANCE
      This represents the distance that ninjas have to be from the player before they will track the player.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Ninja> ninjas
      A list that will hold all of the ninjas, which will dynamically change over the course of the game and initialization.
      private Player player
      A reference to the player object that the player is controlling.
      (package private) java.util.Random RNG
      Random number generator for use with random things.
      private int turnCount
      The number of turns that have taken place since play has started.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Engine()
      Creates a new instance of the engine for a new game.
      Engine(java.io.File save)
      Creates a new instance of the engine from a save file.

      • NINJA_TRACKING_DISTANCE

        private final int NINJA_TRACKING_DISTANCE
        This represents the distance that ninjas have to be from the player before they will track the player. Set this to 0 to stop ninja tracking.

        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()

      • getVisibilityArray

        public boolean[][] getVisibilityArray(Direction direction,
                                      boolean isDebug)
        Makes and returns an array of booleans, each representing whether that square is visible to the player. Used by a UserInterface to figure out what to display to the player. It makes the array by asking the player what squares it can see (probably by checking the player's powerups) and by calling the grid's getPosition method on the object to construct the array. This array will then be used by the UI to construct a representation of the game state.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction the player is looking, or null if the player is not looking.
        Returns:
        an array of booleans, with true meaning that square is visible to the player and false meaning that that square is not visible to the player.

      • getBoard

        public Grid getBoard()
        Getter for board
        Returns:
        value of board

      • setupGrid

        public void setupGrid()
        This method instantiates the Grid object for a new game. It also handles the placement of all Locatable objects.

      • setupGrid

        public void setupGrid(java.io.File save)
        This method does the same thing as setupGrid(), but from a save.
        Parameters:
        save - save file to load from.
